job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Columbia, MO
pros: The staff work incredibly hard, and care deeply for the patients.
cons: Landmark Hospitals is still feeling the repercussions of COVID regarding staff shortages, as many hospitals in our country are.

pros: Great staff who care about their pts. The employees get along really well. They have fun with food and employee engagement activities
cons: Privately held so they can’t always buy the latest and greatest equipment. They don’t do raises every year but they do market adjustments frequently.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Cape Girardeau, MO
pros: The nurses are so kind and helpful
cons: working short staffed really sucks

pros: There are absolutely zero pros
cons: Everything. Staffing, salary, poor management, toxic

pros: Great team work on both days and nights, decent pay/compensation/benefits, felt very family oriented as a whole, great therapy team, decently updated equipment, HR lady was new to her position but always willing to listen and help if she could, decent supply room - usually you had what you needed, great support staff (CNAs, Tele monitor, unit clerk on days only), easy charting system
cons: DON had a lot of personal issues making it difficult to trust her judgment on a lot of things... management can make or break a company. Charge nurse often had full caseload, making it impossible to care safely for the patients and deal with other issues that arise. I worked both days and nights and there were pros and cons to both. More LPNs than RNs and a lot of IV push meds, so the RNs not only have the more acutely I'll patients, they run around helping the LPNs and checking their assessments.

pros: Close parking, a few good nurses, techs(nights) and RT's
cons: ALWAYS short staffed, terrible old equipment ie... computers, walkie-talkies instead of real phones and they barely work. Not enough IV pumps, chairs for nursing staff are all broken and sit two feet from the ground. 80% patient beds don't work properly, PT is terrible, linens are always out, garbage taken out once a day, so the place always smells like poop. It is clear at every turn, management doesn't care about the employees or the patients, just staying under budget so they get their bonuses.

job_title: Director of Business Development in Columbia, MO
pros: Fast paced, new environment each day. Rewarding
cons: Demanding, long hours.stressfull and not much time for family/personal time

pros:
-Nobody cares about your garbage charting or how late you are with medications.
-Much higher pay relative to other area hospitals.
cons:
-Also, nobody cares about your garbage charting or how late you are with medications. 
-Offering employee insurance that is basically useless. I have to pay out of pocket for an x-ray?! Almost no doctors offices accept the insurance, I went to the ER in town and they only paid $200 of a $2300 bill. WoW! 
-Pitiful 401K matching.
-Non-existent raises.
-Management plays favorites.
-Policies? What policies?
-High nurse to patient ratios (1:6 or 1:5) for total care, incredibly demanding patients.
-No call no show? No problems! You'll still be working here because management can't keep staff or hire more.
-Equipment (BP machines, IV machines, Computers) is old despite the hospital being relatively new.
-Medications don't scan correctly about 25% of the time.
-Lack of communication about new policies and procedures.
-High turnover rate
-No tuition assistance
-If you try to do a good job you will be burnt out in no time.

pros:
knowledgable doctors- Dr. Albert and Bookman
Small niche hospital
Great coworkers- you’ll get to know everyone
cons:
Rotating CEOs
Micromanagement from corporate- who you never see and do not know what is going on in each facility
Pay is consistent with beginner positions- rarely see a fair raise
Wear many hats and responsibilities without compensation
Benefits were not great
No cafeteria 
Cut holiday events

pros: Flexible, strong therapy team, variety
cons: Fast pace, lacks in leadership

review_title: Looks pretty, lies on top of lies
pros: Can have whatever schedule and all the OT you want, if you’re willing to turn a blind eye to everything you see that is wrong and terrible
cons: Short staffed, treated like you are a dog, constantly being fed lies by upper management that changes about every other week, as no one stays long. Those that have been there a long time don’t even assess their patients and an employee passed out and we were told “not to touch her” wait for EMS. That’s the day I quit, after ensuring she was ok.

job_title: Certified Occupational Therapist Assistant (COTA) in Columbia, MO
pros:
The patients need us.
Smaller facility
cons:
Lack of teamwork
Some days are like working on an episode of Scrubs. 
Management seems to have difficulty implementing changes for the better of the facility.

pros: Taking care of vulnerable patients
cons: Upper and lower level management, subpar equipment, pay

pros: Love the patients and the acuity of care.
cons: Staffing. No teamwork. Management doesn’t seem to be attentive to concerns.

pros: Just a check. The one stars is for some of the employees who were awesome. But, those employees did not stay long. Really almost no one stays here more than a year.
cons: They change employees like people change underwear. Hostile work environment. If you value your license, look elsewhere. This place is like a sinking ship. Everyone is overworked and stressed. The culture is backstabbing and aggressive. You will be blamed for everything including your manager's poor decisions. Patient ratios are crazy. I've seen 7:1 or more before. CEOs and Nurse Managers get fired all the time. Nobody's job is safe. Feels like leadership is passive aggressive. Everyone is angry and anxious about being fired all the time. You will be lied to about the hours and workload. You will be bullied and setup to fail. Recommend going with a staffing agency instead.

job_title: Acute Dialysis RN in Joplin, MO
pros: CO WORKERS LIKE FAMILY VERY FRIENDLY
cons: SCHEDULING NIGHT MARES AND NEEDS MORE STAFF

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Athens, GA
pros: It’s a Great place to work
cons: Like any job if you work yourself too hard you’ll burn out.

pros: I started working for Landmark a little over eight months ago and I'll admit I had read the reviews and was scared to death to go to work there.  However, you will be happy to know that I have been with Landmark a little over eight months and I think they are a great company.  I honestly feel they work with their employees and strive to build a nice working environment.  They started a 401 K program recently which you can activate after a year.  The have a great policy for PTO - very nice for days off. I feel their pay is fair.  I do enjoy the people I work with at the office and we seem to have a good relationship.  I also feel they are professional.  No child's play.  I honestly don't regret going to work for them.
cons: I don't use their health insurance but I did take a look at the prices and it does appear expensive.  However, I have never used it so I really can't say.  I do think it is a little hard for them to get business and I don't know the reason for that.  They seem a little top heavy with corporate employees.  About my only complaints.

review_title: Some really good nurses, and some not so good as in all places. Same with the PCT'S that really work like NA's.
pros: I enjoy having a variety of patient medical needs to keep a good balance of skills and emotional stress. Most nurses are very nice to work with and PCT's. Would be helpful to have a professional instructor to give teamwork classes.
cons: The New CEO Rodney is aweful. Clueless about working with and  showing his employees that he's there to be a team player, to be a good leader and give employees a feeling of support.   Unbelievable that he kisses these crazy trouble making pshyco family members to where he gives them his personal cell number for them to call him for him to back them up with whatever they say and take on things and bump the staff, especially this one daughter that tried to run into him and he had her arrested. He expected us to tolerate her abuse but when it started to affect him it was a different story. And for the Administration Dept who stole the night shift's lasagna a patient brought to thank them for the care.

job_title: Respiratory Therapist in Cape Girardeau, MO
pros: There are no longer any pros to working here anymore. It's just hanging by a thread. Its very sad.
cons: We no longer have enough staff to perform quality care, we find ourselves working with 1 cna and 1 Respiratory Therapist. The staff has been told that if they don't like it then they can leave and that's exactly what they've done and they aren't replaced because there are not any applicants or because of budget cuts. Staffing is overworked and extremely stressed out. The morale is very poor. We don't get the annual merit raise anymore which has been like that for years now after it dwindled down to a mere 1%. The patients and family complain about the care but with as many high acuity patients we have, getting to them all in a timely manner is virtually impossible. I can't believe state hasn't investigated yet. This place is either closing its doors or the owner is too consumed with the landmark in Florida.

pros:
-Great experience with a wide variety of patients
-Great experience with acute patients
-You will learn what to do in a code
-You will learn how to identify septic patients
-You will be an A+ butt wiper and bed changer
cons:
-Your patients will be very acute
-You will be given more acute patients than is safe
-You will be paid poorly for your position compared to other hospitals in the area and even more poorly for the amount of work you put in
-You will be lied to about the number of patients you will have
-There will not be enough equipment for your patients 
-You will work with great nurses and techs but also incredibly lazy nurses and techs

pros: Great  co workers  & days off is the only Pro I can even think of!! My immediate boss is amazing & truly cares about our department! He would go to bat for any one of us!
cons: Administration could care less about their employees or the patients! All they see is dollar signs & there is so much nepotism in that place it isn’t even funny! Some employees who works for their own family can be late, steal food to take Home to their own family & never get in trouble yet others can’t blow their nose without being wrote up!  I wouldn’t want my worst enemy to work there or be a patient!!

pros: Got our first raise in three years last year and a 401K match last year as well. Things were finally starting to look good. New leadership in the corporate office in 2017 was real good improvement over previous leaders
cons: The founder recenetly fired a bunch of leaders, like three CEOs and a VP in the last three weeks.  Nobody's job is safe  and apparently more firings to come. The culture from the top down today  is if you disagree with the top, you're gone. Everyone is afraid for their jobs. 5 out of 7 CEOs have been with the company less than one year(most only a few months) and they all have their resumes out.

pros: Landmark pays nurses well, starting around 30$/hr. Some make mid 30's. Floor staff very helpful and good work environment. When census is high, they allow a lot of overtime. Nurses get to use many skills, including IV's, blood draws, feeding tube placements, wound vacs/wound care, art lines, ACLS, etc.
cons: Health insurance is expensive. Cheapest family plan around $800/month. They don't match anything on 401K. Small hospital size means when the census is low they call a lot of people off.

review_title: Great place to work if you are motivated and have a positive attitude!!!
pros:
o  Flexible scheduling
o  Educational Reimbursement
o  Supportive Administrative Staff 
o  Team Building Environment
o  Advancement Opportunities
o  Competitive Hourly Salary
o  Opinions at every level are considered
cons:
o  Lack of motivation with some staff (improving)
o  Complacency (improving)

pros: Great staff, great pay for PRN status, fulfilling work! I have worked here for a year and have no complaints! As a recent graduate PTA I have gained so much valuable experience, hope to work in ltach for remainder of career!
cons: Only con for me is that i don't work here full time status! Some personal tension between some employees but that is expected anywhere!

pros: I like my Director of Nursing. She is approachable and I believe she cares about her staff.
cons: I don't think corporate has realistic staff ratios.  Benefits need to be improved.

pros: Pay and  I have met some great people at Landmark though that will end up being possible forever friends.
cons:
New orienteers are on their own from day 1. Staff is only considered as
"numbers" and management only cares that you work unless you are a favorite. Short-staffed, ICU setting with 6 patients per 1 staff (should only be 3). Mostly all agency staff because they can not keep permanent staff. Highly toxic environment, no teamwork, feel like you are in high school.
Different standards and discipline for different staff.

pros: The staff are great. Enjoy working with them side by side
cons: This was a great company until a new CEO took over in Dec. They no longer care about staff or patients. It’s only about the bottom line. Management is dishonest, and not trustworthy. Benefits are terrible. Promise bonuses then don’t pay them. Run! I thought the owner just didn’t know what is going on. It is now clear he does and Doesn’t care. Only about saving a penny while not paying their bills

job_title: Charge Nurse in Cape Girardeau, MO
pros: Good Frontline Nursing Staff. Dedicated CNAs overall.Decent pay. Great Respiratory and PT were very skilled. New building esthetically appealing.
cons: Nepotism, hire friends and family.  If your not "in" with management your schedule will suck, you will be set up to fail.

review_title: Landmark Hospital of Southwest FL - Naples
pros: Smaller company, a lot of opportunities for growth, professional team and management, CEO is very approachable and cares about his team/hospital, new hospital with advanced equipment, nice patient rooms with windows, natural lighting, super clean
cons: Has a 401-K plan but no match yet, but hopefully eventually

job_title: Admissions & Billing Coordinator in Columbia, MO
pros:
-Work was appreciated
-Staff was always friendly
-Good learning experience
cons:
-Everyday was the same
-Low census, so sometimes employees were sent home

review_title: needs better nursing management and a  better team effort from charge nurses
pros: There were good nurses there
cons: The nurses were overworked no teamwork with staff and charge nurses and alot of infighting which is unprofessional .

pros: Clean and new environment. Good location for an LTAC as not any other competing facilities that offer long term acute care.
cons: Nurses are poorly treated. Under staffed. Nurses have too many patients. High turnover of staff especially nursing. Poor and inexperienced nursing management. Maintenance slow to respond to problems.

pros: This hospital is a pretty good place to work and offers career advancement.
cons: Upper management can sometimes forget about the lower level positions.

job_title: Corporate Business Office Director in Cape Girardeau, MO
pros: Great clinical outcomes, decent benefits
cons: Poor business management and treatment of employees

job_title: PRN RN in Cape Girardeau, MO
pros: I guess better than being unemployed
cons: Charge nurse just dropped F-bombs around a family last night because they wanted to leave, embarrassing to the "good" staff.  I need to be checking my own BP around here. Looking for new employment. This is a very hostile work environment!

pros: Small hospital, growing business. CEO and leadership team vet approachable and caring.
cons: Benefits are ok, but could be better. No 401k match

job_title: Chief Executive Officer in Joplin, MO

cons: none to mention at this stage in my career

pros: Good salary.  Helpful and involved administration.
cons: Frequently being call off due to low patient census. Poor benefits.

pros: attractive facility, some very patient  focused clinicians.
cons: High turnover, hostile environment, low census

pros: Good people, good work environment
cons: company financially unstable which caused layoffs

pros: The team is why i work here
cons: Corporate never comes to see what we do

pros: nice coworkers, very easygoing atmosphere
cons: company doesnt like to pay for tech

pros: Great co workers that care about the patients. Good compensation.
cons: Not very truthful to employees. Benefits are very expensive. Deceitful practices with employees.

job_title: Clinical Liaison in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Great nurses that really cared about their jobs.
cons: The owner and upper management are absolutely nuts. Horrible personnel skills, if they are breathing they are lying. Have no idea how to create a sales plan.

pros: SOME of the staff are great!!
cons: Incompetent management. Harsh work environment in which many co-workers are angry, hostile, aggressive and abusive.
